description: Proposed single storey side and rear infill extension following partial removal of outrigger at ground floor level.
decision_conditions: <p><span id="docs-internal-guid-248fa515-7fff-da63-e94a-99f7a156ad0a"><span style="font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline;">The proposed development, by reason of its design, siting, scale, loss of private amenity areas and cumulative impacts from past permissions and its built form is considered an overdevelopment of the site which will also adversely impact on occupant amenities . &nbsp;</span></span>The proposal is therefore contrary to policies 7.4 ‘Local Character’, 7.6 ‘Architecture’ of the London Plan 2016 (as amended), and policies LP1 ‘Design Quality and Local Character’ and LP2 'Development and Amenity' of the Hackney Local Plan 2033 and guidance contained within Hackney Residential Extensions and Alterations SPD 2009 and the 'NPPF' 2019 (as amended).&nbsp;</p>

The proposed development, by reason of its internal layout and configuration, constitutes a cramped and over-intensive use of the building and the site, resulting in accommodation that fails to meet the minimum space standards for residential accommodation as set out in the Mayors Housing Supplementary Planning Guidance; lacks adequate facilities commensurate with modern living standards, and is thereby contrary to Policy 3.5 of the London Plan 2016 (as amended), and HBC's general requirements for residential development and policies LP1 ‘Design Quality and Local Character’ and LP2 'Development and Amenity' of the Hackney Local Plan 2033 and guidance contained within Hackney Residential Extensions and Alterations SPD 2009 and the 'NPPF' 2019 (as amended) and the Nationally described Space Standards from the Technical Housing standards 2015.

<p style="margin-bottom: 0px; font-stretch: normal; line-height: normal;" helvetica="" neue";"="">The proposed terrace area at the rear of the property, by reason of its intended use, siting/location and depth, would adversely impact on neighbour amenities by virtue of privacy intrusion.&nbsp; The proposal is therefore contrary to policies 7.4 ‘Local Character’, 7.6 ‘Architecture’ of the London Plan 2016 (as amended), and policies LP1 ‘Design Quality and Local Character’ and LP2 'Development and Amenity' of the Hackney Local Plan 2033 and guidance contained within Hackney Residential Extensions and Alterations SPD 2009 and the 'NPPF' 2019 (as amended).&nbsp;</p>
